required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 13, 2016
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Enzalutamide (Formerly MDV3100) as a Neoadjuvant Therapy for Patients Undergoing Prostatectomy for Localized Prostate Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open-Label, Phase 2 Study of MDV3100 as a Neoadjuvant Therapy for Patients Undergoing Prostatectomy for Localized Prostate Cancer

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if enzalutamide is an effective therapy in treating localized prostate cancer prior to prostatectomy.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: Pathologic complete response rate following triplet therapy (enzalutamide in combination with leuprolide and dutasteride) and enzalutamide alone when administered as neoadjuvant therapy for 6 months prior to prostatectomy in patients with localized prostate cancer. Pathologic complete response is defined as the absence of morphologically identifiable carcinoma in the prostatectomy specimen, as evaluated by the site pathologist using standard methods.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Positive Surgical Margins
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the percentage of patients with positive surgical margins at prostatectomy as assessed by the local and central pathologist.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Extracapsular Extension: Local Review
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the percentage of patients with extracapsular extension at prostatectomy as assessed by the local pathologist.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Extracapsular Extension: Central Review
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the percentage of patients with extracapsular extension at prostatectomy as assessed by the central pathologist.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Positive Seminal Vesicles
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the percentage of patients with positive seminal vesicles at prostatectomy as assessed by the local and central pathologist.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Positive Lymph Nodes
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the percentage of patients with positive lymph nodes at prostatectomy as assessed by the local and central pathologist.

secondary_outcome.measure: Prostate-Specific Antigen (PSA) Nadir
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the effects on PSA as measured by the lowest postbaseline PSA value prior to prostatectomy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Prostate-Specific Antigen (PSA) Nadir
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the effects on PSA as measured by the time to the lowest postbaseline PSA value prior to prostatectomy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Reduction in Prostate-Specific Antigen (PSA)
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the effects on PSA as measured by the percentage of patients with PSA < 0.2 ng/mL, and a 50% and 90% decrease in PSA value prior to prostatectomy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Health-Related Quality of Life (HRQoL): The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite (EPIC) Sexual Domain Summary Score
secondary_outcome.description: EPIC Sexual Domain is an HRQoL instrument that measures the effects of prostate cancer treatment on a patient's sexual function and sexual satisfaction. Best change from baseline category in EPIC sexual domain summary score is summarized below. Categories are worsened (decrease of at least 1 minimally important difference), stable (changed by less than 1 minimally important difference), or improved (increase of at least 1 minimally important difference). Minimally important difference is defined as one-half the standard deviation of the score of interest at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Health-Related Quality of Life (HRQoL): The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite (EPIC) Sexual Function Subscale Score
secondary_outcome.description: EPIC Sexual Domain is an HRQoL instrument that measures the effects of prostate cancer treatment on a patient's sexual function and sexual satisfaction. Best change from baseline category in EPIC sexual function subscale score is summarized below. Categories are worsened (decrease of at least 1 minimally important difference), stable (changed by less than 1 minimally important difference), or improved (increase of at least 1 minimally important difference). Minimally important difference is defined as one-half the standard deviation of the score of interest at baseline.

Best change from baseline category in EPIC sexual bother subscale score is summarized below. Categories are worsened (decrease of at least 1 minimally important difference), stable (changed by less than 1 minimally important difference), or improved (increase of at least 1 minimally important difference). Minimally important difference is defined as one-half the standard deviation of the score of interest at baseline.

Best change from baseline category in EPIC hormonal domain summary score is summarized below. Categories are worsened (decrease of at least 1 minimally important difference), stable (changed by less than 1 minimally important difference), or improved (increase of at least 1 minimally important difference). Minimally important difference is defined as one-half the standard deviation of the score of interest at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Health-Related Quality of Life (HRQoL): The Twelve-Item Short Form Version 2 General Health Domain Score
secondary_outcome.description: The Twelve-Item Short Form Version 2 is an HRQoL instrument that measures general health and well-being across physical and mental components. Best change from baseline category in general health domain score is summarized below. Categories are worsened (decrease of at least 1 minimally important difference), stable (changed by less than 1 minimally important difference), or improved (increase of at least 1 minimally important difference). Minimally important difference is defined as one-half the standard deviation of the score of interest at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Health-Related Quality of Life (HRQoL): The Twelve-Item Short Form Version 2 Physical Functioning Domain Score
secondary_outcome.description: The Twelve-Item Short Form Version 2 is an HRQoL instrument that measures general health and well-being across physical and mental components. Best change from baseline category in physical functioning domain score is summarized below. Categories are worsened (decrease of at least 1 minimally important difference), stable (changed by less than 1 minimally important difference), or improved (increase of at least 1 minimally important difference). Minimally important difference is defined as one-half the standard deviation of the score of interest at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Health-Related Quality of Life (HRQoL): The Twelve-Item Short Form Version 2 Role-Emotional Domain Score
secondary_outcome.description: The Twelve-Item Short Form Version 2 is an HRQoL instrument that measures general health and well-being across physical and mental components. Best change from baseline category in role-emotional domain score is summarized below. Categories are worsened (decrease of at least 1 minimally important difference), stable (changed by less than 1 minimally important difference), or improved (increase of at least 1 minimally important difference). Minimally important difference is defined as one-half the standard deviation of the score of interest at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Health-Related Quality of Life (HRQoL): The Twelve-Item Short Form Version 2 Mental Component Summary
secondary_outcome.description: The Twelve-Item Short Form Version 2 is an HRQoL instrument that measures general health and well-being across physical and mental components. Best change from baseline category in mental component summary is summarized below. Categories are worsened (decrease of at least 1 minimally important difference), stable (changed by less than 1 minimally important difference), or improved (increase of at least 1 minimally important difference). Minimally important difference is defined as one-half the standard deviation of the score of interest at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamic Effects: Tissue Dihydrotestosterone (DHT)
secondary_outcome.description: To determine pharmacodynamic effects as measured by tissue DHT in prostatectomy specimens following radical prostatectomy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamic Effects: Tissue Testosterone
secondary_outcome.description: To determine pharmacodynamic effects as measured by tissue testosterone in prostatectomy specimens following radical prostatectomy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamic Effects: Assessment of Apoptosis
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the effects of triplet therapy and enzalutamide alone on apoptosis in prostatectomy specimens. Assessment of apoptosis was not performed due to limited amounts of tissue available.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamic Effects: Assessment of Mitotic Index
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the effects of triplet therapy and enzalutamide alone on mitotic index (rate of cell growth) in prostatectomy specimens.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamic Effects: Assessment of Androgen Receptor Signaling
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the effects of triplet therapy and enzalutamide alone on androgen receptor signaling in prostatectomy specimens.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Dihydrotestosterone (DHT): Baseline
Serum Dihydrotestosterone (DHT): 6 Months Postbaseline
Change From Baseline in Serum Dihydrotestosterone (DHT)
secondary_outcome.description: To determine serum hormone effects as measured by change in DHT values from baseline to the completion of therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Testosterone: Baseline
Serum Testosterone: 6 Months Postbaseline
Change From Baseline in Serum Testosterone
secondary_outcome.description: To determine serum hormone effects as measured by change in testosterone at baseline and at completion of therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Adverse Events (AEs) That Led to Dose Interruption, Dose Reduction, and Study Drug Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the number of patients with AEs that led to permanent discontinuation of enzalutamide, temporary interruption of enzalutamide, dose reduction of enzalutamide, or study drug (enzalutamide, leuprolide, or dutasteride) discontinuation.

arm_group.description: Enzalutamide 160 mg, orally, once daily and leuprolide 22.5 mg, intramuscular injection, every 3 months, and dutasteride, 0.5 mg, orally, once daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Willing to provide informed consent
- 18 years of age or older
- Histologically confirmed adenocarcinoma of the prostate
- Must be a candidate for radical prostatectomy and considered surgically resectable
Exclusion Criteria:
- Stage T4 prostate cancer by clinical or radiologic evaluation
- Treatment with an investigational agent within 4 weeks prior to randomization
- Received therapy for other neoplastic disorders within 5 years
- Hypogonadism or severe androgen deficiency

group.title: Enzalutamide & Leuprolide & Dutasteride
group.description: Enzalutamide 160 mg, orally, once daily and leuprolide 22.5 mg, intramuscular injection, every 3 months, and dutasteride, 0.5 mg, orally, once daily

group.title: Enzalutamide & Leuprolide & Dutasteride
group.description: Enzalutamide 160 mg, orally, once daily and leuprolide 22.5 mg, intramuscular injection, every 3 months, and dutasteride, 0.5 mg, orally, once daily

outcome.title: Pathologic Complete Response Rate
outcome.description: Pathologic complete response rate following triplet therapy (enzalutamide in combination with leuprolide and dutasteride) and enzalutamide alone when administered as neoadjuvant therapy for 6 months prior to prostatectomy in patients with localized prostate cancer. Pathologic complete response is defined as the absence of morphologically identifiable carcinoma in the prostatectomy specimen, as evaluated by the site pathologist using standard methods.
outcome.population: All patients randomly assigned to study treatment (intent-to-treat population) with a prostatectomy sample evaluated by the local and central pathologist.

group.title: Enzalutamide & Leuprolide & Dutasteride
group.description: Enzalutamide 160 mg, orally, once daily and leuprolide 22.5 mg, intramuscular injection, every 3 months, and dutasteride, 0.5 mg, orally, once daily

Pathologic complete response is defined as the absence of morphologically identifiable carcinoma in the prostatectomy specimen, as evaluated by the site pathologist using standard methods.

measure.title: Percentage of Patients With Extracapsular Extension: Local Review
measure.description: To determine the percentage of patients with extracapsular extension at prostatectomy as assessed by the local pathologist.

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients With Extracapsular Extension: Central Review
outcome.description: To determine the percentage of patients with extracapsular extension at prostatectomy as assessed by the central pathologist.
outcome.population: All patients randomly assigned to study treatment (intent-to-treat population) with a prostatectomy sample evaluated by the central pathologist. One patient in the Enzalutamide alone treatment arm was excluded from the analysis because the result reported by the central lab was indeterminate.

outcome.title: Health-Related Quality of Life (HRQoL): The Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite (EPIC) Sexual Domain Summary Score
outcome.description: EPIC Sexual Domain is an HRQoL instrument that measures the effects of prostate cancer treatment on a patient's sexual function and sexual satisfaction. Best change from baseline category in EPIC sexual domain summary score is summarized below. Categories are worsened (decrease of at least 1 minimally important difference), stable (changed by less than 1 minimally important difference), or improved (increase of at least 1 minimally important difference). Minimally important difference is defined as one-half the standard deviation of the score of interest at baseline.
outcome.population: All patients randomly assigned to study treatment (intent-to-treat population) with a baseline and at least one postbaseline score.

group.description: Enzalutamide 160 mg, orally, once daily and leuprolide 22.5 mg, intramuscular injection, every 3 months, and dutasteride, 0.5 mg, orally, once daily

group.description: Enzalutamide 160 mg, orally, once daily and leuprolide 22.5 mg, intramuscular injection, every 3 months, and dutasteride, 0.5 mg, orally, once daily

measure.title: Health-Related Quality of Life (HRQoL): The Twelve-Item Short Form Version 2 Physical Functioning Domain Score
measure.description: The Twelve-Item Short Form Version 2 is an HRQoL instrument that measures general health and well-being across physical and mental components. Best change from baseline category in physical functioning domain score is summarized below. Categories are worsened (decrease of at least 1 minimally important difference), stable (changed by less than 1 minimally important difference), or improved (increase of at least 1 minimally important difference). Minimally important difference is defined as one-half the standard deviation of the score of interest at baseline.

outcome.title: Health-Related Quality of Life (HRQoL): The Twelve-Item Short Form Version 2 Role-Emotional Domain Score
outcome.description: The Twelve-Item Short Form Version 2 is an HRQoL instrument that measures general health and well-being across physical and mental components. Best change from baseline category in role-emotional domain score is summarized below. Categories are worsened (decrease of at least 1 minimally important difference), stable (changed by less than 1 minimally important difference), or improved (increase of at least 1 minimally important difference). Minimally important difference is defined as one-half the standard deviation of the score of interest at baseline.
outcome.population: All patients randomly assigned to study treatment (intent-to-treat population) with a baseline and at least one postbaseline score.

measure.description: The Twelve-Item Short Form Version 2 is an HRQoL instrument that measures general health and well-being across physical and mental components. Best change from baseline category in role-emotional domain score is summarized below. Categories are worsened (decrease of at least 1 minimally important difference), stable (changed by less than 1 minimally important difference), or improved (increase of at least 1 minimally important difference). Minimally important difference is defined as one-half the standard deviation of the score of interest at baseline.

Best change from baseline category in mental component summary is summarized below. Categories are worsened (decrease of at least 1 minimally important difference), stable (changed by less than 1 minimally important difference), or improved (increase of at least 1 minimally important difference). Minimally important difference is defined as one-half the standard deviation of the score of interest at baseline.
outcome.population: All patients randomly assigned to study treatment (intent-to-treat population) with a baseline and at least one postbaseline score.

Best change from baseline category in mental component summary is summarized below. Categories are worsened (decrease of at least 1 minimally important difference), stable (changed by less than 1 minimally important difference), or improved (increase of at least 1 minimally important difference). Minimally important difference is defined as one-half the standard deviation of the score of interest at baseline.

outcome.title: Pharmacodynamic Effects: Tissue Dihydrotestosterone (DHT)
outcome.description: To determine pharmacodynamic effects as measured by tissue DHT in prostatectomy specimens following radical prostatectomy.
outcome.population: All patients randomly assigned to study treatment (intent-to-treat population) with a prostatectomy sample evaluated by the central pathologist.

group.title: Enzalutamide & Leuprolide & Dutasteride
group.description: Enzalutamide 160 mg, orally, once daily and leuprolide 22.5 mg, intramuscular injection, every 3 months, and dutasteride, 0.5 mg, orally, once daily

measure.title: Pharmacodynamic Effects: Tissue Dihydrotestosterone (DHT)
measure.description: To determine pharmacodynamic effects as measured by tissue DHT in prostatectomy specimens following radical prostatectomy.

outcome.title: Pharmacodynamic Effects: Tissue Testosterone
outcome.description: To determine pharmacodynamic effects as measured by tissue testosterone in prostatectomy specimens following radical prostatectomy.
outcome.population: All patients randomly assigned to study treatment (intent-to-treat population) with a prostatectomy sample evaluated by the central pathologist.

group.title: Enzalutamide & Leuprolide & Dutasteride
group.description: Enzalutamide 160 mg, orally, once daily and leuprolide 22.5 mg, intramuscular injection, every 3 months, and dutasteride, 0.5 mg, orally, once daily

measure.title: Pharmacodynamic Effects: Tissue Testosterone
measure.description: To determine pharmacodynamic effects as measured by tissue testosterone in prostatectomy specimens following radical prostatectomy.

outcome.title: Pharmacodynamic Effects: Assessment of Apoptosis
outcome.description: To determine the effects of triplet therapy and enzalutamide alone on apoptosis in prostatectomy specimens. Assessment of apoptosis was not performed due to limited amounts of tissue available.

outcome.title: Pharmacodynamic Effects: Assessment of Mitotic Index
outcome.description: To determine the effects of triplet therapy and enzalutamide alone on mitotic index (rate of cell growth) in prostatectomy specimens.

outcome.title: Pharmacodynamic Effects: Assessment of Androgen Receptor Signaling
outcome.description: To determine the effects of triplet therapy and enzalutamide alone on androgen receptor signaling in prostatectomy specimens.

outcome.title: Serum Dihydrotestosterone (DHT): Baseline
outcome.population: All patients randomly assigned to study treatment (intent-to-treat population) with a baseline serum DHT result.

outcome.title: Number of Patients With Adverse Events (AEs) That Led to Dose Interruption, Dose Reduction, and Study Drug Discontinuation
outcome.description: To assess the number of patients with AEs that led to permanent discontinuation of enzalutamide, temporary interruption of enzalutamide, dose reduction of enzalutamide, or study drug (enzalutamide, leuprolide, or dutasteride) discontinuation.
outcome.population: All patients who received at least one partial dose of enzalutamide.

group.title: Enzalutamide & Leuprolide & Dutasteride

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: PI agrees not to independently publish the results before the publication of the multi-center PI paper. Sponsor shall review and comment 30 days prior to submission or disclosure. If publication or disclosure contains Sponsor Confidential Information, other than study data, PI agrees to remove Confidential Information from publication or disclosure. Sponsor may request that PI delay such publication for an additional 60 days to protect the patentability of any invention described.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: William Novotny, MD, Sr. Director, Clinical Development
